qas.question: What is the name of the area inside the Berggarten that hosts one of the world's biggest collection of orchids?
What historic landmark is near the entrance to the Berggarten?
What is the name of the first tropical aquarium in Germany?
Other than orchids and birds, what else is housed in the Orchid House?
What is the name of a minor European botanical garden?
What is the name of the first aquarium in Germany?
What else can be found in the tropical house besides orchids and birds?
What mausoleum can be found in the great garden?
What pavilion is found near the entrance of the great garden?

context: <b5_0>The Berggarten<b5_0/> is an important <a0_0>European botanical garden<a0_0/>.[citation needed] Some points of interest are the Tropical House, the Cactus House, the Canary House and the <a1_0>Orchid House<a1_0/>, which hosts one of the world's biggest collection of orchids, and free-flying birds and <a4_0><b7_0>butterflies<b7_0/><a4_0/>. Near the entrance to the Berggarten is <b9_0>the historic <a2_0>Library Pavillon<b9_0/><a2_0/>. The Mausoleum of <b8_0>the Guelphs<b8_0/> is also located in the Berggarten. Like the Great Garden, the Berggarten also consists of several parts, for example the Paradies and the Prairie Garden. There is also the <a3_0><b6_0>Sea Life Centre Hanover<a3_0/>,<b6_0/> which is the first tropical aquarium in Germany.[citation needed]
